File.Title: Are you sure that your disease surveillance did not miss a lot of malaria cases?
File.HtmlText:
The attack rate for malaria reported in the trial is an average of 1 clinical attack per year per child, over the different participating sites. This varied considerably from less than 0.1 episode per year to more than 5 episodes per year in high transmission areas.

In the phase III efficacy trial, over the first 20 months of follow-up, approximately 180,000 outpatient sick visits happened, of which almost 100,000 were for febrile illnesses. According to the study protocol(a,b), a blood test was done to confirm or eliminate the diagnosis of malaria in all children presenting with a febrile illness. Malaria was found in 16-17% of the febrile cases, but the high rate of clinic visits indicates a very robust surveillance system for malaria in this trial, making it highly unlikely that malaria cases would have been missed.
